message:
NT Fire and Rescue Service
NT FIRE AND RESCUE SERVICE MESSAGE

LOCATION: Warrego Road, Tennant Creek

ALERT LEVEL: Advice - Decreasing Threat - There is a reduced level of threat. You can resume normal activities.

FIRE TYPE: Bushfire.
INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 15/12/2025 18:10:00

STATUS: UNDER CONTROL - The fire is at a stage where fire fighting resources are only required for patrol purposes and major re-ignition is unlikely.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: Smoke from this fire may affect visibility, Active fire may occur close to the roadside, Firefighting crews may be working close to the roadside.

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: For the safety of firefighting crews and other vehicles, drivers in the area are urged to slow down, turn on headlights and drive safely for the conditions.

üöß OIL SPILL - STUART HIGHWAY üöß

Motorists are urged to be aware of an oil spill on the Stuart Highway, 50km north of Katherine.

The north bound lane is currently closed. Motorists are urged to follow all traffic control measures in place.

To stay up to date visit road report.nt gov au.

‚ö†Ô∏è SEVERE HEAT HEALTH WARNING ‚ö†Ô∏è

High temperatures are expected on Tuesday 9 December and Wednesday 10 December 2025, with a Severe Heat Heath Warning in place in the following regions:

üìç Lasseter
‚óæ Curtain Springs
‚óæ Docker River
‚óæ Uluru
‚óæ Yulara

Severe heat can be dangerous. While older people, babies, children, people with medical conditions and pregnant and breastfeeding women are most at risk, anyone can be affected, including pets.

Residents and visitors are urged to take action to avoid heat stress and dehydration by:

‚úÖ Staying cool in air-conditioning where possible
‚úÖ Drinking cold or iced water
‚úÖ Decreasing physical activity
‚úÖ Applying SPF 50+ sunscreen
